repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
add `force` option and make `nvim_set_hl` works like `highlight` command


Fix #21119

comment_data.body: This part should not be done. It is a _deliberate_ difference of the API that links are not somehow less worth than filling in attributes.
isn't it enough to just check if `force` is set here and then override this check right here? I don't think making the code more convoluted below is needed or desired.
before tried but test case failed.

these will failed if move before link set the `default link` can't set .  test case from issue 23023 reproduce step
 
```lua
    meths.set_hl(0, 'Bar', {link ='Boolean', default = true })
    eq('Bar            xxx guifg=#123456',
      exec_capture('highlight Bar'))
    command('hi clear')
    eq('Bar            xxx links to Boolean',
      exec_capture('highlight Bar'))
```
`boolean` is redundant if we say "if true". also "when it exists" to be inglish grammar.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(highlight): add force in nvim_set_hl
